text: was a Japanese politician. He was a member of the Democratic Party of Japan. He was a member of the House of Councillors in the Diet from 1999 until his death. Hata was born in Tokyo. He was the Minister of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism from June 4, 2012 until December 26, 2012 during the Yoshihiko Noda cabinet.Prime Minister of Japan and His Cabinet website The Cabinet - Yuichiro Hata Retrieved on August 15, 2012 Hata was the son of Prime Minister Tsutomu Hata. Hata died in Tokyo on December 27, 2020 after being hospitalized with a fever, aged 53.立民 羽田雄一郎元国交相が死去 53歳 He was about to be tested for COVID-19 at the time of his death. ==References== Category:1967 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Politicians from Tokyo Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Tokyo Category:Ministers of land, infrastructure, transport and tourism of Japan
title: Yuichiro Hata
